moves.1... d5 2. Bf4 Nf6 3. Nf3 e6 4. e3 a6: I guess black is trying to prevent Bb5, and white continues with developing his pieces
moves.5. Nbd2 c5 6. c3 cxd4 7. exd4 Be7 8. Bd3: I have reached this position in several games and am very comfortable
moves.9... O-O 10. O-O b6 11. Ne5 Bb7 12. Ndf3: The knights are poised to put pressure on the black position
moves.12... Ne4: I can win a pawn here
moves.13. Bxe4 dxe4 14. Qxe4 Qd5: Black offers an exchange which also restricts the bishop, I think I'll take it
